## PolyAsyncIterable.mapKeys() method

Return an iteration of the pairs resulting of calling `func(element)` for every element in `this` and using it as the first element of the pair (the \*key\*) and preserving the second (the \*value\*).

**Signature:**

```typescript
mapKeys<K1, K2, V>(this: PolyAsyncIterable<[K1, V]>, func: AsyncIndexedMapping<[K1, V], K2>, options?: ConcurrencyOptions): PolyAsyncIterable<[K2, V]>;
```

[AsyncIndexedMapping](./polyethylene.asyncindexedmapping.md)<!-- -->&lt;\[K1, V\], K2&gt;

A function that takes an element of `this` and returns something else


</td></tr>

options


</td><td>

</td><td>

</td></tr>

**Returns:**

[PolyAsyncIterable](./polyethylene.polyasynciterable.md)<!-- -->&lt;\[K2, V\]&gt;

A new [PolySyncIterable](./polyethylene.polysynciterable.md) that yields the results of calling `func(element)` for every element of `this` and using it to replace the keys

## Remarks

This method is only available for iterations of pairs.
